Plot Depth Ratio (DR) Genome-wide

Source: R/plot_genome_wide_mutations.R
plot_DR_gw.Rd

This function generates a plot showing the Depth Ratio (DR) genome-wide for a specific sample.

Usage

plot_DR_gw(seq_res, sample, chromosomes = paste0(c(1:22, "X", "Y")), N = 5000)

Arguments

seq_res

A data frame containing sequencing results in wide format.

sample

The name of the sample for which the plot will be generated.

chromosomes

A character vector specifying the chromosomes to include in the plot. Default is all autosomes and sex chromosomes.

N

The number of mutations to sample for plotting. Default is 5000.

Value

A ggplot2 object showing the DR distribution across the genome.

Examples

sim <- new(Simulation)
sim$add_mutant(name = "A",
               growth_rates = 0.2,
               death_rates = 0.0)
sim$place_cell("A", 500, 500)
sim$run_up_to_time(100)
#> 
 [████████████████████████████████████████] 100% [00m:00s] Saving snapshot                                                                                                                                    


n_w <- n_h <- 10
ncells <- 0.8 * n_w * n_h
bbox <- sim$search_sample(c("A" = ncells), n_w, n_h)

sim$sample_cells("Sample", bbox$lower_corner, bbox$upper_corner)

forest <- sim$get_samples_forest()
m_engine <- build_mutation_engine(setup_code = "demo")

  phylo_forest, 
  chromosomes = c('22'), 
  coverage = 10, 
  write_SAM = F
)
